alert.note: Alert for Kent; New Castle (Delaware) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 07 at 6:52PM EDT until August 07 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Delaware...and northeast Maryland...including the following counties...in Delaware...Kent and New Castle. In northeast Maryland...Caroline, Kent, Queen Anne`s, and Talbot. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 651 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly across portions of the advisory area. Rainfall totals of 1 to 2 inches are possible in a short amount of time. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Dover, Middletown, Easton, Centerville, Talbot, Smyrna, Chestertown, Denton, Centreville, Camden, Clayton, and Greensboro. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
